result.execSummary:
The defendant Duane E Savage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Duane E Savage in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF16, 16CM762, and 15CF517.  In 16CM762 Rights/ Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to both Cts.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to 16CF16 and 15CF517.  Conditions of probation include:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA assessment and comply with treatment.  Complete domestic violence counseling and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Ct. 1 $543.00 costs.  Ct. 2 $343.00 costs.   In 15CF517 Court sentenced defendant to on Ct. 2 to 9 months jail, with Huber for work and treatment.  Ct. 3 90 days jail, with Huber for work and treatment, concurrent to Ct. 2.  A civil judgment will be entered for unpaid financial obligations on this case.  97 days credit.  In 16CF16  Court sentenced defendant to 3 months jail, with Huber for work and treatment, consecutive to 15CF517.  A civil judgment will be entered for unpaid financial obligations on this case.  17 days credit.   11:10/11:28
filed by Agent Erin Graf

Cases called: 16CF16 & 15CF517, Defendant Duane E Savage in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 16CF16, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Cases called: 16CF16 & 15CF517, Defendant Duane E Savage in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 15CF517, Defendant plead nolo to cts. 2&3 and Ct. 1 in 16CF16. Court found guilty, 2 yr. probation in each case, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Domestic abuse counseling. Submit DNA sample. In 15CF517, $543, $343 costs. In 16CF16, $518 costs. Cash bond applied. All other counts read in and dismissed. Jail credit: 4 days credit in 15CF517, 17 days in 16CF16.
